Class ApplicationDatabase

java.lang.Object
Database.ApplicationDatabase
public class ApplicationDatabase extends Object
Singleton class that manages the storage and retrieval of Application objects. Applications are stored in memory and persisted to a CSV file.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ApplicationDatabase getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of ApplicationDatabase.
      Returns:
      the single instance of ApplicationDatabase

    • loadData

      public void loadData() throws IOException
      Loads application data from a CSV file into memory. Skips entries with invalid status or flat type, and skips if user or project not found.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue reading the file

    • saveData

      public void saveData() throws IOException
      Saves the in-memory application list to a CSV file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue writing the file

    • addApplication

      public void addApplication(Entity.Application application)
      Adds a new application to the list.
      Parameters:
      application - the application to add

    • findApplications

      public List<Entity.Application> findApplications()
      Returns all applications.
      Returns:
      list of all applications

    • findByProject

      public List<Entity.Application> findByProject(Entity.Project project)
      Finds applications associated with a specific project.
      Parameters:
      project - the project to filter by
      Returns:
      list of applications for the given project

    • findByApplicantNric

      public Entity.Application findByApplicantNric(String nric)
      Finds an application by the applicant's NRIC.
      Parameters:
      nric - the NRIC of the applicant
      Returns:
      the application or null if not found

    • findByWithdrawal

      public List<Entity.Application> findByWithdrawal(boolean withdrawal)
      Finds applications by withdrawal status.
      Parameters:
      withdrawal - true to find withdrawn applications, false otherwise
      Returns:
      list of applications matching the withdrawal status
